text:
In my opinion, my parents are the people who were the most influential in the choosing of my studies, it is not like they choose for me, it is more like they pushed me to work. It started at the beginning of the secondary school. They were always asking if my homeworks were done or if i red my lessons. At first sight i though it was bad because most of my classmates parents were not really carring about their children marks. So since this moment, i always felt like my parents were carring too much and it oppressed me. After the secondary school, i grew up, so things appeared to me differently but it took time for me to realise the fact that i was lucky to have my parents carring a lot about my studies. I can remember now this one sentence my mother were always telling me: "you study for you, not for us". The first time i heard it, i was completely not agreeing with it because i was studying for them, i did not wanted to be a shame for them. As i said i realize by growing up how i was false. So i went to the scientific section in highschool because i had great marks in chemistry and mathematics. I realized that my parents allows me to chose what i really wanted to study.
I went to ESIR right after the Baccalauréat because i did not wanted to do infomartic, the "prépa" in ESIR is specialised in chemistry and physics, this course is great because it is containing many informatic classes and it is no far way from my parents house. In my everyday life, clothes and shoes are one of my passions. So i though that i could combine sciences and clothes in my studies. Developping new materials for footwear and sportclothes is one of the target i aim at by studying at ESIR. My other target is to live good with my job, my parents helped me a lot, i want to help them back. As my girlfriend is studying in art, it pushes me to get my degree to work with her, together we will create new shoes or clothes designs, made up with eco-friendly and amazing materials!
